thread.title: Malibu’s Sundance Ranch Asks $18 Million

author: Katherine Clarke
title: Malibu’s Sundance Ranch Asks $18 Million
text:
5 COMMENTS Sundance Ranch, a Malibu, Calif., equestrian property once owned by George Roy Hill, director of “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid,” is coming on the market for $18 million.
Mr. Hill, who also directed the movies like “Thoroughly Modern Millie” and “The Sting,” owned the property in the 1970s, public records show. He died in 2002.
About 15 miles from Santa Monica, the nearly 11-acre ranch overlooks the ocean and includes the original 1953 ranch house owned by Mr. Hill. The 2,139-square-foot house has four bedrooms, three bathrooms, an office and an outdoor dining area with views of the ocean. It also has rustic exposed wood beam ceilings, a Jacuzzi, a pool, a fire pit, a zip line and an outdoor shower. ​ There is space to expand and build additional structures, pending approvals, according to the listing.
Sundance Ranch, a Malibu, Calif., equestrian property once owned by George Roy Hill, director of ‘Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid,’ is seeking $18 million. Photo: James Moss There are also two horse barns with 24 new stalls and a riding arena. Kumquat, pomegranate, lemon and lime trees grow on the land.
The sellers are Damon Fisher, 49, a co-founder of EdgeLine Capital Partners, a financial advisory firm, and his wife Debbie Fisher, 50, who works with International Medical Corps., a nonprofit humanitarian aid organization. They bought the main home and surrounding horse barns for about $2.3 million in 2001, public records show, and later added an adjacent parcel of land for about $1.5 million.
More Private Properties
Soho Penthouse in Renzo Piano-Designed Building Seeks $40.5 Million April 26, 2018 East Hampton Home of Late Goldman Sachs Partner Sells for $40 Million April 23, 2018 Penthouse on a Private Island in Florida Asks $40 Million April 19, 2018 Ms. Fisher said she and her husband are selling the property because their two sons, who are both in high school, prefer to spend their time in the mountains, where they enjoy skiing. She is the only member of the family who enjoys horse riding, she said.
Denise Snanoudj and Craig Knizek of the Agency have the listing.
Write to Katherine Clarke at katherine.clarke@wsj.com
